info.description: # ðŸš€ Get started here This template guides you through CRUD operations (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE), variables, and tests for the 100x Microblogging API. ## ðŸ”– **How to use this API** #### **Step 1: Send requests** RESTful APIs allow you to perform CRUD operations using the POST, GET, PUT, and DELETE HTTP methods. This collection contains each of these request types. Open each request and click "Send" to see what happens. #### **Step 2: View responses** Observe the response tab for status code (200 OK), response time, and size. #### **Step 3: Send new Body data** Update or add new data in "Body" in the POST request. Typically, Body data is also used in PUT request. ``` json { "name": "Add your name in the body" } ``` #### **Step 4: Update the variable** Variables enable you to store and reuse values in Postman. We have provided a variable called `base_url` with the sample request \`[https://one00x-data-analysis.onrender.com` . ](https://one00x-data-analysis.onrender.com) [Replace it with your API endpoint to customize this collection. When working locally, this could http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) or whatever port your local server is running on. #### **Step 5: Add tests in the "Tests" tab** Tests help you confirm that your API is working as expected. You can write test scripts in JavaScript and view the output in the "Test Results" tab. ## ðŸ’ª Pro tips - Add more scripts in "Tests" to verify if the API works as expected and execute flows. - Inspect all requests and responses carefully; both headers and body
